gpcm.gpcm module¶

class gpcm.gpcm.CGPCM(*args, **kw_args)[source]¶

Bases: gpcm.gpcm.GPCM

CGPCM variant of the GPCM.

Takes in the same keyword arguments as gpcm.GPCM, but the keyword causal defaults to True.

name = 'CGPCM'¶

Formatted name.

Type

str

class gpcm.gpcm.GPCM(*args, **kw_args)[source]¶

Bases: gpcm.model.AbstractGPCM

GPCM and causal variant.

Parameters

  • scheme (str, optional) – Approximation scheme. Defaults to structured.

  • causal (bool, optional) – Use causal variant. Defaults to False.

  • noise (scalar, optional) – Observation noise. Defaults to 1e-4.

  • fix_noise (bool, optional) – Do not learn the observation noise. Defaults to False.

  • alpha (scalar, optional) – Decay of the window.

  • alpha_t (scalar, optional) – Scale of the window. Defaults to normalise the window to unity power.

  • window (scalar, alternative) – Length of the window. This will be used to determine alpha if it is not given.

  • fix_window (bool, optional) – Do not learn the window. Defaults to False.

  • gamma (scalar, optional) – Decay on the prior of \(h\).

  • scale (scalar, alternative) – Length scale of the function. This will be used to determine gamma if it is not given.

  • fix_scale (bool, optional) – Do not learn the length scale. Defaults to False.

  • omega (scalar, optional) – Decay of the transform \(s\) of \(x\). Defaults to length scale half the spacing between the inducing points.

  • n_u (int, optional) – Number of inducing points for \(u\).

  • n_u_cap (int, optional) – Maximum value for n_u. Defaults to 300.

  • t_u (vector, optional) – Locations of inducing points for \(u\). Defaults to equally spaced points across twice the filter length scale.

  • n_z (int, optional) – Number of inducing points for \(s\).

  • n_z_cap (int, optional) – Maximum number of inducing points. Defaults to 300.

  • t_z (vector, optional) – Locations of inducing points for \(s\). Defaults to equally spaced points across the span of the data extended by twice the filter length scale.

  • extend_t_z (bool, optional) – Increase the number of inducing points for \(z\) to additionally and appropriately cover an extension of the length of the filter on both sides.

  • t (vector, alternative) – Locations of interest. Can be used to automatically initialise quantities.

compute_I_hz(t)¶

Compute the \(I_{hz,t_i}\) matrix for \(t_i\) in t.

Parameters

  • model (gpcm.GPCM) – Model.

  • t (vector) – Time points of data.

Returns

Value of \(I_{hz,t_i}\), with shape

(len(t), len(model.t_z), len(model.t_z)).

Return type

tensor

compute_I_ux(t1=None, t2=None)¶

Compute the \(I_{ux}\) integral.

Parameters

  • model (gpcm.GPCM) – Model.

  • t1 (tensor, optional) – First time input. Defaults to zero.

  • t2 (tensor, optional) – Second time input. Defaults to zero.

Returns

Value of \(I_{ux}\) for all t1, t2.

Return type

tensor

compute_I_uz(t)¶

Compute the \(I_{uz,t_i}\) matrix for \(t_i\) in t.

Parameters

  • model (gpcm.GPCM) – Model.

  • t (vector) – Time points \(t_i\) of data.

Returns

Value of \(I_{uz,t_i}\), with shape

(len(t), len(model.t_u), len(model.t_z)).

Return type

tensor

Returns

\(K_u\).

Return type

Compute the \(I_{hx}\) integral.

Parameters

  • model (gpcm.GPCM) – Model.

  • t1 (tensor, optional) – First time input. Defaults to zero.

  • t2 (tensor, optional) – Second time input. Defaults to zero.

Returns

Value of \(I_{hx}\) for all t1 and t2.

Return type

tensor

Kernel function associated to the filter \(h\).

Parameters

  • t1 (tensor) – First input \(t_1\).

  • t2 (tensor) – Second input \(t_2\).

Returns
